entry.title: The evolution of member ordering in SAP Analytics Cloud
entry.content:
Introduction

This short blog post explains the old “Edit Member Order” for the Classic Table in the Optimized Design Experience (ODE), how it evolved into "Custom Order" with the New Table Build Experience in ODE proposed in the QRC3 2025, and what happens when you migrate Tables.

Ordering affects readability, storytelling, and how business users consume KPIs. Small UX changes here have big impact, so this is worth a quick, clear look.

 

“Edit Member Order” for [Measures] (in Optimized Design Experience – ODE)

In Classic Table (ODE), “Edit Member Order” is the manual-ordering capability used primarily for [Measures] (including calculated measures). It lets authors control the sequence of measure’s members at the same level so tables present KPIs in the exact order the business expects.

Default sorts (alphabetical, model order, or value-driven) don’t always match a narrative. Manual ordering lets you put priority metrics first, arrange measures in a business-friendly sequence, or mirror a report layout stakeholders expect.

To use it, the workflow is as follows:

  1. Open the story and switch to “Edit”;
  2. Select the table widget and open the “Builder Panel”;
  3. Locate the [Measures] you want to reorder in the Builder Panel. Click the “three-dot menu” on the measure dimension;
  4. Choose “Edit Member Order…”;
  5. In the Edit Member Order dialog, drag measures to the desired order. “Done” to apply.

 

“Custom Order” for [Measures] (ODE with New Table Build Experience)

The new approach. When switching to the New Table Build Experience (ODE), the manual ordering for [Measures] was redesigned.

The ordering control for dimension members now lives on the header region and is called “Custom Order”. This is separate from the Classic measure-centric “Edit Member Order” and is the natural, header-level experience for arranging rows or columns that come from a dimension. And It puts dimension ordering next to other column header-level actions:

  • Improve discoverability for row/column member ordering.
  • Consolidate table configuration for a clearer, more predictable authoring workflow.

To use it on [Measures], the workflow is now as follows:

  1. Open the story in Optimized Design Experience (ODE) and switch to “Edit”;
  2. Make sure you have activated the option “Switch All Tables To New Table Build Experience”;
  3. In the table widget, right-click the Measure header you want to reorder;
  4. Choose “Sort options” >> “Add Custom Order…” from the menu;
  5. In the “Create Custom Order” dialog, drag members into the desired sequence or use the movement controls. Create/save to update the table.

 

Migration behavior

Functionally, ordering controls were modernized and surfaced where they make the most sense in the New Table Build Experience.

When you migrate Classic Table to the New Table Build Experience in ODE:

  1. The “Edit Member Order option” is no longer available;
  2. Any previously defined Member Order on Measure is preserved and displayed as the default;
  3. If you want to change the default order, you can create one or multiple Custom Orders.

 

Demo

 

Conclusion

We modernized ordering so it’s more discoverable and aligned to the object type: measures order remain managed via the Builder Panel pattern in Classic Table, while all dimension members, including Measures in the New Table Build Experience are reordered from the table column’s header “Sort options >> Custom Order…”. And Converting Classic Table preserves your predefined orders as the default order.

 

Let us know what you think

We want this transition to be smooth and useful. Do not hesitate to share your feedbacks, it directly influences documentations and product improvements. Tell us:

  • Did your measure orders migrate as expected?
  • Any cases where dimension ordering behaved unexpectedly in the New Table Build Experience?

entry.title: UPDATE: SAP Datasphere and SAP Analytics Cloud Availability via SAP Business Data Cloud
entry.content:
After the announcement on July 1st regarding the availability of SAP Datasphere and SAP Analytics Cloud (public option) via SAP Business Data Cloud (BDC), the reaction was of great excitement and interest in learning more about the next steps especially about the tenant rewiring option to move existing tenants to SAP BDC. If you missed the announcement, you could read it here: Announcement: SAP Datasphere and SAP Analytics Cloud - SAP Community

The objective of this blog is to share with you the latest information about the tenant rewiring and what it involves.

First, what does it mean for an SAP Datasphere or SAP Analytics Cloud to be rewired?

A tenant rewiring does not mean artefacts or data migration, it mainly refers to the consumption approach (from a commercial model perspective) of these services, and to the customer facing tool to manage the tenant lifecycles (via SAP for Me).  The tenant itself will remain the same, and the URL of the current tenants will not change either. In addition, there are no additional charges for rewiring an SAP Datasphere or SAP Analytics Cloud tenant to SAP BDC.

Second, how will the tenant rewiring work?

There are two paths for customers when it comes to how the tenant rewiring will work.

Customers may have started their consumption of SAP Datasphere or SAP Analytics Cloud (public option) via one of the following consumption models:

  • A subscription of the services where the tenants are provisioned and managed by SAP
  • A subscription of the services where the tenants are provisioned self-service by customers via the customers SAP BTP Global Accounts.

The tenant rewiring tool will support both models; however, the way the process is triggered will be different.

For the SAP-managed / provisioned tenants, the tenant rewiring will be initiated automatically as soon as you update your subscription with SAP (via your SAP account team) to move your subscription from the standalone product subscription to the SAP BDC subscription. This means that the tenant rewiring will be initiated as part of your subscription change request, and the tenant will automatically move to SAP BDC.

When you have a new subscription to SAP BDC, you will receive an email notification from SAP to log into your SAP for Me account. You will need to activate your BDC cockpit in your appropriate data center. If these steps are done prior to the tenant rewiring process, you will be able to see the rewired tenants in your BDC formation as soon as the process is completed.

NOTE: You must use the same hyperscaler and the same data center for your BDC cockpit as your current standalone subscription. The tenant rewiring tool does not migrate tenants between hyperscalers or data centers.

It is important to mention that the tenant will be available for your end users during the process and there is no tenant downtime required by the tenant rewiring tool.

For the tenants that are provisioned self-service via the customers SAP BTP Global Account, your admin will be able to initiate the tenant rewiring directly via the BTP Global Account, also self-service. The only pre-condition required is that a BDC subscription must pre-exist before triggering the tenant rewiring process to move the tenant to SAP BDC.

The steps are as follows:

  • BTP Admin goes in the BTP Global Account / BTP cockpit and updates the BTP Service instance related to the tenant
  • The request is received by SAP and the process is initiated to update the tenant and move it to BDC
  • Login to SAP for Me and, login to BDC, go to the resources tab where you will be able to find the rewired tenants under “bdc-rewired” resource group.
  • Once the rewiring is completed, the tenant will be visible in BDC

Overall, the tenants are preserved and now will be consumed via SAP BDC.

For more information and step-by-step, visit the tenant rewiring documentation.

SAP Analytics Cloud in this blog refers to the following:

  • SAP Analytics Cloud for business intelligence, public system option
  • SAP Analytics Cloud for planning, standard edition, public system option
  • SAP Analytics Cloud for planning, professional edition, public system option
  • SAP Analytics Cloud, test tenant, public system option

entry.title: 🟡 Introducing the Devtoberfest Scavenger Hunt 🔨🪙 ... COMING SOON
entry.content:
Welcome to the Devtoberfest Scavenger Hunt, a chase around important SAP developer-related tools/sites, a challenge to construct a secret phrase, and a chance to win 1000s of points toward the Devtoberfest grand prize.

The hunt officially starts Sept. 25, with the release of the first clue during that day's SAP Developer News, and you have until the end of Devtoberfest, Oct. 24, to complete it.

To get all the clues make sure to SUBSCRIBE TO THIS POST!!

Learn more about the  entire Devtoberfest event in @KevinR's post Devtoberfest 2025 Welcome!.

What you need to find

We have hidden a special phrase, which you need to figure out using the clues from several missions, described in the next section. Along your journey you will do the following:

  1. Visit about 10 different locations related to SAP developers, mostly web sites that are designed to help you in your daily SAP development.
  2. At each location, you will discover a set of hexadecimal digits.
  3. Concatenate the digits together (in the order of the missions) to get one, 37-digit hexadecimal number.
  4. Multiply that hexadecimal number by another secret number, for which we will give a clue.
  5. Take the resulting 38-digit hexadecimal product, and convert it into the secret phrase, using each pair of digits as values for ASCII characters.
  6. Enter the phrase, exactly (case-sensitive, no extra spaces), into the Scavenger Hunt tutorial.‌

Not until the SAP Developer News of Oct. 16 will you have all the pieces to be able to complete the phrase.

As an example of what you will have to do, here's a short sample hunt (just a warm-up, no points will be earned). Each mission is independent of the other.

entry.title: Guide for Inline Translations of Embedded SAC Stories in SAP Sales & Service Cloud V2 and SAP ESM
entry.content:
Embedded SAC stories in Sales & Service Cloud V2 and SAP ESM include a useful feature called Inline Translation. This feature allows customers to create and manage translations for story-related metadata during story creation or editing.

Inline Translation vs. Metadata Translation vs. Data Translation

It’s easy to mix up these three terms, so here’s a simple breakdown:

  • Inline Translation
    Refers to metadata created within an Embedded SAC Story. Examples include the story title, description, page titles, and widget titles. In short, anything you create inside the Embedded SAC environment.
  • Metadata Translation
    Applies to the metadata of Sales & Service Cloud V2 and SAP ESM—for example, the titles of data sources and their fields. This feature is not yet supported but will be available soon.
  • Data Translation
    Refers to translations of actual business data, such as code descriptions and extension code lists, in Sales & Service Cloud V2 and SAP ESM. This is already supported.

How to Enable Inline Translation

Enabling Inline Translation is a two-step process. Please note that this needs to be done for each story individually.

Step 1: Enable Translation for a Story

This is a one-time setup per story.

  1. Go to All Settings → Analytics → Design Stories.
  2. Select the story you want to translate and click Edit.
  3. In edit mode, click the gear icon under the File section, then select Story Details.
  4. In the pop-up window, turn on the Enable Translation toggle and click Save.
  5. After the pop-up closes, save the story again.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Important: The language you are logged in with becomes the source language for that story. This cannot be changed later. Make sure you log in with the correct language before enabling translations.

Step 2: Maintain Translations for Target Languages

This step must be repeated for every target language you want to support.

  1. Open the Embedded SAC story in Edit mode.
  2. From the menu, select Tools → Inline Translation (or More → Tools → Inline Translation).
  3. In the pop-up, choose the Target Language from the dropdown list.
  4. Update the text fields with the translated content. The source language text will appear by default.
  5. Click Done, then save the story.

 

 

 

 

 

 

What Business Users Will See

Once translations are maintained, your business users will automatically see story texts in the language they use to log in to Sales & Service Cloud V2 or SAP ESM.

entry.title: [Portuguese] SAP Business Data Cloud: Sessões de Expert-Guided Implementation
entry.content:
Find English Version here.

O SAP Business Data Cloud é uma solução SaaS que unifica e governa todos os dados da SAP e se conecta perfeitamente a dados de terceiros, oferecendo aos líderes de linha de negócios contexto para tomar decisões ainda mais impactantes.

A SAP está mudando a forma como os dados são compartilhados em cada uma de suas linhas de negócios usando a eficiência dos conceitos de malha de dados e cópia zero. Queremos fornecer uma abordagem de arquitetura de infraestrutura de dados verdadeira para funções analíticas. Avanços na Inteligência Artificial também ressaltaram a importância de dados limpos e semanticamente ricos. O SAP Business Data Cloud conecta todos os dados, aproveitando os princípios da infraestrutura de dados de negócios, facilitando a descoberta, o compartilhamento, a governança e o modelo de dados.

 

🚀Capacite sua jornada de dados: Apresentamos nossa nova série de SAP Business Data Fabric Workshop

No cenário digital acelerado de hoje, os dados são mais do que apenas um recurso – é um ativo estratégico. Empresas de todo o mundo estão evoluindo para tomar decisões mais rápidas, inteligentes e conectadas usando plataformas de dados modernas. Para dar suporte a essa evolução, temos o prazer de anunciar nossa renovada série de workshops Expert-Guided Implementation (EGI) do SAP Enterprise Support, desenvolvidos para ajudá-lo a aprimorar, modernizar e preparar seus recursos de dados e funções analíticas da SAP para o futuro.

Quer você queira modernizar sistemas legados, aproveitar o poder dos dados na nuvem ou desvendar insights em tempo real por meio de funções analíticas, esta série de workshops tem algo para todos.

As sessões EGI a seguir serão executadas ao longo do ano com atualizações trimestrais na programação. Há um máximo de 20 participantes individuais do cliente por sessão.

 

1. SAP Business Data Cloud Core Skills (sessões em português)

Nesta nova sessão de EGI, forneceremos uma compreensão concreta dos casos de uso do SAP Business Data Cloud e apresentaremos os recursos importantes e os componentes incluídos com a ajuda de orientação de líderes especializados para que você possa ver mais rapidamente o retorno sobre o investimento ao iniciar seu próprio projeto.

Você receberá uma análise detalhada abrangente do SAP Business Data Cloud, incluindo os aspectos mais técnicos, como Intelligent Applications, Data Products, opções de conectividade e muito mais.

Agenda:

  • Entender o valor que o SAP Business Data Cloud traz além do SAP BW, SAP Datasphere e SAP Analytics Cloud
  • Conhecer os principais recursos e componentes
  • Como utilizar Intelligent Applications para entrega rápida de soluções
  • Saber como a SAP está usando o conceito de Data Products em cada LoB
  • Possibilidades de integração com empresas SAP, não SAP e SAP Databricks
  • Roadmap da solução
  • Disponibilidade da solução
  • Essencialmente, o participante será bem informado sobre o valor que o SAP BDC pode agregar à organização e poderá utilizar Intelligent Applications de forma produtiva desde o início.

Registre-se Aqui 

 

 2. SAP BW Modernization with SAP Business Data Cloud (sessões em inglês)

Nesta sessão de EGI, forneceremos uma compreensão clara dos caminhos de transição disponíveis do SAP BW (por exemplo, BW/4HANA, BW on HANA, Private Cloud Edition etc.) para o SAP Business Data Cloud. Você receberá insights abrangentes sobre as inovações arquitetônicas agora disponíveis com o SAP Business Data Cloud.Munidos deste conhecimento, iremos guiá-lo através de estratégias práticas de migração.

Agenda:

  • Visão geral da modernização do SAP BW com o BDC e o SAP Data Product Generator
  • Inovações arquitetônicas, permitindo que os participantes conectem conceitos do SAP Business Data Cloud para modernizar o SAP BW
  • Lakehouse Architecture na Datasphere com Object Store
  • Delta Sharing com Databricks
  • SAP BW Transition Path para o SAP Business Data Cloud

Registre-se Aqui

 

3. SAP Datasphere Core Skills (sessões em inglês e em mandarim)

​ O SAP Datasphere é a solução abrangente de gerenciamento de dados que integra, governa e compartilha dados em ambientes híbridos e multinuvem, como parte do SAP Business Data Cloud.
Este workshop de EGI já está em execução desde agosto de 2024. Você pode ler uma descrição detalhada sobre neste blog anterior da SAP Community: SAP Datasphere Core Skills: Expert-Guided Implementation.

entry.title: Embedded Analytics - How to Analyze System/Browser/Network Performance ?
entry.content:
How to Analyze System Performance in Embedded Analytics ?

You can analyze your system performance using the Measurement Tool, or viewing a variety of stories that provide statistics and analysis.

 

To access the tool, from the side navigation, choose  System  -   Measurement Tool.

Client Test Score

The client test runs several scripts on the local machine and calculates a normalized score. Using current best practices, the client score can be categorized as follows:

  • Excellent: Score >= 75
  • Good: Score >= 50 and <75
  • Poor: Score < 50

Bandwidth measures the megabits per second (Mbps) transferred from server to client when downloading and uploading data. A higher bandwidth number is better than a lower number.

To improve your client score while keeping your existing hardware configuration, watch out for CPU intensive applications and processes that may have a negative impact on your SAP Analytics Cloud performance. For example:
  • Business video conferencing services
  • Virus scanning
  • Synchronizing shared network drives

Network Test Score

Latency is measured in milliseconds (ms). It describes the time it takes from the starting request until the response arrives. A good latency is a ping rate within a low milliseconds range.

The network score may be negatively affected by other applications consuming the bandwidth, various network configurations, or different network issues. For example:
  • Virtual Private Networks (VPN)
  • Firewalls
  • Corporate bandwidth
  • Internet bandwidth
  • Database performance (live data connections)
  • SAML IdP logon time

Optimize System Performance with the Analysis Tool

As an administrator of an SAP Analytics Cloud tenant, you can use the Performance Analysis Tool and the decision tree below to find resources that will help you resolve performance issues.

Who does this apply to?
  • Users with Read and Update permissions for System Information.
  • Admin and BI Admin standard application roles.

The following instructions apply primarily to SAP Analytics Cloud (public and private). Some sections may also be applicable to SAP Analytics Cloud, Embedded edition depending on feature availability.

Use the Performance Decision Tree

Follow the steps in the following decision tree to find resources that will help you to resolve performance issues.

This image is interactive. Hover over each area for a description. Click highlighted areas for more information.

 Guidance on Performance Testing

Caution

According to the General Terms and Conditions for SAP Cloud Services it is prohibited to perform any action on the cloud service which circumvents or endangers its operation or security.


Please note, performance testing might have a serious effect on private instances as well as on shared instances where the SAP Analytics Cloud tenant resides with multiple customer tenants on same instance. This is important because services being used on a certain system are shared among other customers. Due to that reason, performing stress or performance testing is only allowed on SAP Analytics Cloud Private Edition tenants.
  • When in doubt, reach out to your Account Team (Account Executive or Customer Success Professional) to clarify whether you are allowed to do the performance test or not.
  • Understand that the performance and specifications of non-production environments may not be the same as production environments. UAT performance testing cannot be performed on non-production systems.
  • As this is considered a support operation please notify SAP (through your Account Team) at least 15 business days in advance of the test so we can monitor the systems to avoid any outage.
Caution

A general stress test might create a load that could endanger the operation of the cloud service.

entry.title: SAP 分析云中统计图的增强功能
entry.content:
随着 SAP 分析云2025 年第三季度 QRC 版本的发布，我们很高兴推出一系列针对统计图的增强功能，这些功能旨在在优化体验中为您提供更大的灵活性和控制力。本次更新致力于提升仪表板的视觉表现力和分析精确度，帮助您以更清晰的方式讲述数据故事。 

在本文中，我们将重点介绍以下主要增强功能： 

  • 数值点图的新设计 
  • 网格线 
  • 坐标轴标题 
  • 坐标轴线条粗细 
  • 分组类别分隔线的颜色和粗细 

您可以在文中找到示例，了解这些改进如何在视觉上提升您现有的仪表板效果。 

 

数值点图的新设计 

数值点图经过了重新设计，目前更加契合现代化仪表板的美学风格，且可读性也得到了提高。全新的外观确保关键数据能够更加突出，帮助用户快速掌握绩效指标。 

鉴于新版数值点图与原有设计差异较大，我们决定该功能需在每个统计图中单独启用，并且一旦启用就无法撤销或恢复至旧版。对于新建统计图，该设计将默认启用。 

 

网格线 


我们在统计图中引入了网格线功能，可通过设计器中的“显示/隐藏”设置进行开启或关闭。网格线有助于提升图表的可读性，尤其是在部分数据点因标签冲突而无法显示时，它能帮助用户更容易地解读数据。用户还可以通过样式面板对网格线的颜色进行自定义设置。 

 

坐标轴标题 

为了让查看者更好地理解统计图内容，设计者现在可以为坐标轴添加标题，用于展示所绑定对象的名称。这有助于明确每个坐标轴所表示的数据。 

在坐标轴标题方面，用户可以自定义标题的颜色和位置。对于 X 轴标题，支持左对齐、居中和右对齐；对于 Y 轴标题，则支持居中和顶部对齐。 

坐标轴线条粗细 

现在可以通过样式面板中“坐标轴线”选项来调整坐标轴线条的粗细，提供细、中、粗三种设置。此功能既可满足不同的设计偏好，也可用于在统计图中突出展示特定要素。 

 

 

 

分组类别分隔线的颜色和粗细 

设计者现在可以自定义分组维度之间分隔线的颜色和粗细。此改进能够提升分组数据的清晰度，并帮助更有效地区分不同的区段。 

 

在本文中，我们还希望重点介绍一些在先前版本中已发布、且可能对您有帮助的改进功能。主要增强包括： 

  • 在微件级别调整柱状图宽度 
  • 改进折线图表的数据标签位置 
  • 在百分比堆积柱状图中支持排序 

 

在微件级别调整柱状图宽度 


现在，您可以在微件级别调整柱状图的宽度，而无需依赖图表缩放功能，从而让设计者对单个柱状图和条形图的外观拥有更大的控制权。 

当设置了控件级别的柱状图宽度后，该设置会覆盖图表缩放中的柱宽以及图表的默认柱宽配置。但除柱宽外，其他图表缩放设置仍然会继续生效。 

 

改进折线统计图的数据标签位置 


我们优化了折线类统计图中数据标签的显示位置，以提升可读性。标签现在会根据图表布局和可用空间进行更智能的放置，从而确保信息呈现更加清晰。 

 

百分比堆积柱状图的排序 

我们现在支持对百分比堆积柱状图进行排序，用户可以根据数值或度量来对类别进行排列。此增强功能有助于改进数据分析，使趋势和对比的解读更加直观和清晰。 

 

这些增强功能是我们持续努力的一部分，旨在为用户提供更精确、更可定制以及更具视觉吸引力的 SAP分析云工具。请持续关注后续更新，我们将不断优化平台，以满足您不断发展的分析需求。 

原文链接：Chart Enhancements in SAP Analytics Cloud - SAP Community

原作者：Tunir

entry.title: Seamless Integration of Google Cloud BigQuery with SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC): Step-by-Step Guide
entry.content:
On a recent project, I integrated Google Cloud BigQuery with SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC). After exploring both platforms, I’ve put together a simple, step-by-step guide—plus a few key features—to help you connect them quickly. BigQuery handles huge datasets with speed, while SAC turns that data into clear reports, dashboards, and plans. Together, they take you from raw numbers to smarter decisions.

In this blog, I’ll show you exactly how to set up the integration—from creating a table in BigQuery to keeping your SAC model updated and refreshed.

Key Benefits of BigQuery–SAC Integration

  • Seamless Cloud-to-Cloud Integration – No complex middleware; connect directly between GCP and SAC.
  • Analytics Made Simple: SAC lets you turn data into dashboards, forecasts, and actionable insights.
  • Faster Decision-Making – SAC visualizations update as soon as data refreshes, giving near real-time insights.
  • Collaboration Made Easy – SAC allows teams across finance, operations, and strategy to work with the same live data.
  • Automation – Schedule regular refreshes so your dashboards and reports stay up to date automatically.

Prerequisites

Before we dive in, you’ll need:

  1. A Google Cloud project with BigQuery enabled.
  2. Access to an SAP Analytics Cloud tenant with permissions to create models and connections.
  3. A BigQuery dataset and an SAC model that share the same schema. (The column data types in BigQuery must match the dimensions and measures in your SAC model.)

Step 1: Create a Table in Google BigQuery

  1. Open GCP Console and navigate to BigQuery Studio.
  2. Create a Dataset within your GCP project.
  3. Within the dataset, create a Table and define its schema. Ensure the schema aligns with the structure of your SAC model (synchronized dimensions and measures). Since I created a table with multiple data types, you can see its schema in the image below.

  4. Populate the table with data if it’s empty. You can do this via:

    • Python Notebook in GCP .
    • Manual uploads (CSV/JSON).

Example workflow to load data into a BigQuery table (if it has no existing data): Navigate to 'Notebooks' within your GCP project, open a new notebook, load the data using Python, and then verify that the table is populated with the required test or business data. For this example, I loaded some test data into the table using Python code in a notebook.       

Step 2: Prepare the Model in SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC)

  1. Log in to SAP Analytics Cloud.
  2. Navigate to Modeler and create a Blank Model.
  3. Ensure the model structure (dimensions and measures) matches the BigQuery table schema.The image below shows the measures and dimensions, with data types matching those in the BigQuery table.

Step 3: Create a Connection Between SAC and BigQuery

  1. In SAC, go to Main Menu > Connections.
  2. Click on Add Connection (+).
  3. Choose Google BigQuery.
  4. Sign in using the same Google account linked to your GCP project.
  5. Once authenticated, select the relevant Project from the dropdown.
  6. Save the connection. You’ve now linked SAC with your BigQuery environment.

Step 4: Import Data from BigQuery into SAC

  1. Navigate to your SAC model and open Data Management.
  2. Select Import Job.
  3. Choose Google BigQuery as the data source.
  4. Select the connection you created earlier.

      5. Choose between:

  • Freehand SQL Query (for custom queries).
  • Build a Query (drag-and-drop interface) (For most use cases, Build a Query works best: - Select your dataset and table. - Add all required dimensions and measures. - Finalize your query). Here, I chose the Build a Query option, as shown in the image below.

6.  Configure the import job by:

  • Preparing the data.
  • Mapping dimensions to facts
  • Reviewing and confirming the import steps.

7. Run the import. Once completed, SAC will display a success notification along with row-level details in the job timeline.

Step 5: Validate the Imported Data

  1. Navigate back to your Model Structure Workspace in SAC.
  2. Verify that the data has been successfully imported.
  3. Ensure measures and dimensions are mapped correctly.
  4. Test the model with basic visualizations or planning functions to confirm accuracy.
  5. As shown in the image below, the entire BigQuery table is now visible in the Data Foundation area.

Step 6: Refresh and Schedule Your Import Job

One-time imports are fine for demos, but real business data changes constantly. Luckily, SAC lets you refresh and schedule updates:

  • Update: Brings in the latest changes while keeping existing data.
  • Append: Adds new rows without touching what’s already there.
  • Clean and Replace: Wipes the old dataset and replaces it with fresh data.

You can also schedule refreshes (daily, weekly, or custom) so your dashboards are always up to date — no manual work required.

Key Takeaways

  • Integration is straightforward once the schemas in BigQuery and SAC are aligned.
  • BigQuery serves as a powerful backend, while SAC empowers users with visualization and planning tools.
  • Refresh options and scheduling help keep your models in sync automatically

Conclusion

Integrating Google BigQuery with SAP Analytics Cloud isn’t complicated, but it’s incredibly powerful. With just a few steps, you can combine BigQuery’s scalable data engine with SAC’s interactive analytics and planning features. Whether you’re experimenting with test data or working at an enterprise level, the process is the same: build your table, set up your model, connect, import, validate, and schedule updates.

By following the steps in this guide, you can set up the integration with ease and keep your models refreshed automatically.

entry.title: Master Data Management via Business Data Cloud: Datasphere & Seamless Planning in combination
entry.content:
SAP Datasphere and SAC Seamless Planning will play an increasingly important role in the future. Since Seamless Planning is still a relatively young product, its current interaction capabilities with SAP Datasphere are limited. Nevertheless, this example demonstrates how master data from SAP Datasphere can already be enriched and managed using Seamless Planning.

Setup SAP Datasphere

Let us assume that we have two tables in SAP Datasphere:

  • Customer Table
    • CustomerNumber
    • CustomerName
    • Country
    • RegionCode
  • Region Table
    • RegionCode
    • Description

Our goal is to assign regions to customers via Seamless Planning and maintain the description of the regions.

To achieve this, we create local tables for both dimensions and expose them through fact view and analytical model for SAC consumption. (For the fact view, we simply added a row counter as a key figure.)

  1. Customer Table
  2. Customer Fact View
  3. Customer Analytical Model

SAC Data Preview:

And like this for the Region Model

  1. Region Table
  2. Region Fact View
  3. Region Analytical Model

SAC Data Preview:

Setup SAP Analytics Cloud

In SAC we also create two dimensions, one for Customer Region Assignment and one for the Region. We then expose both to SAP Datasphere.

The dimension for the Customer Region Assignment looks like this in SAC:

It also has a property with region:

The Dimension for Region looks like this:

We then also create a Dummy Planning Model which will hold our dimension and Dummy Keyfigure as it is required. This one is also exposed to SAP Datasphere.

Setup Planning Application in SAP Analytics Cloud

We then build a story in SAC, including:

  • The two analytical models (Customer and Region)
  • The dummy planning model

Tables with the data can be displayed (or hidden in a real application).

Customer Region Assignment

In the Customer Region Assignment tab, we add two dropdowns, one for the Customer Selection and one for the Region it should be assigned. On the initialization we fill the dropdowns with the following script:

var customers = Customer.getDataSource().getMembers("CustomerNumber");
var customerName = Customer.getDataSource().getMembers("CustomerName");

console.log(customers);

for (var i = 0; i<customers.length;i++){
	CustomerDropdown.addItem(customers[i].displayId, customerName[i].displayId);
	
}

var regions = Region.getDataSource().getMembers("RegionCode");
console.log(regions);


for (var j = 0; j<regions.length;j++){
	RegionDropdown.addItem(regions[j].displayId);
	
}

This way the dropdown gets filled with our Data from the Analytical Models and the dimension values from SAP Datasphere.

An Assignment could then be done by selecting the Customer and the Region.

When the Save button is pressed the script performs the following actions and updates the dimension:

var region = RegionDropdown.getSelectedKey();
var customer = CustomerDropdown.getSelectedKey();
var customerText = CustomerDropdown.getSelectedText();

console.log(region);
console.log(customer);

CustomerInput=({id:customer, description:customerText ,properties:{Region:region}});
console.log(CustomerInput);

DummyModel.updateMembers("CustomerRegionAssignment",CustomerInput);

As the dimension is stored in Datasphere we can now see the values in the Seamless planning table.

We now add this table in a Transformation flow as Source and add this information to our original Datasphere table which holds the Customer Information.

Region Text Maintenance

In this tab we do something very similar. We add one Dropdown to select for which region you want to maintain the text and one text input to maintain it. The dropdown is again filled upon initialization of the page with the following script:

var regions = RegionText.getDataSource().getMembers("RegionCode");
var regionsText = RegionText.getDataSource().getMembers("Description");

for (var j = 0; j<regions.length;j++){
	RegionTextDropdown.addItem(regions[j].displayId, regionsText[j].displayId);
	
}

And that based on the selection the text input is filled:

var sel = RegionTextDropdown.getSelectedText();
console.log(sel);

RegionTextMaint.setValue(sel);

In the application this looks like:

Upon the Button execution the dimension is updated:

var region = RegionTextDropdown.getSelectedKey();
var regionText = RegionTextMaint.getValue();

console.log(region);
console.log(regionText);

RegionTextInput=({id:region, description:regionText});
console.log(CustomerInput);

DummyModel.updateMembers("Region",RegionTextInput);

Identical to the example above the value is then stored in SAP Datasphere and a Transformation Flow writes the value into its original table:

Conclusion and Outlook

In practice, transformation flows could be triggered through a task chain, initiated by a multi-action in SAC. This will become easier once SAP provides an API to trigger task chains, or by using our solution to wrap the task chain CLI (Link ZPARTNER; Link SAP Community).

Looking ahead, the goal is for transformation flows to become unnecessary—enabling direct master data management in Seamless Planning, similar to the functionality available in SAP BW/4HANA.

Even though Seamless Planning is still a young functionality, with some creativity and ideation, it already offers ways to enrich SAP Datasphere data and design new planning processes using SAP’s latest cloud technology stack.

entry.title: SAP 分析云新增提醒功能，助您轻松管理数据更改日志
entry.content:
在已经发布的2025 年 QRC3 版本中，SAP 分析云全新推出“数据更改日志通知”功能，可在日志规模演变成问题前，第一时间发出提醒，让维护计划环境的健康更轻松。 

概述   

您现在可以配置提醒，当数据更改日志达到指定大小时主动通知您。这一点在多人协作的大型计划环境中尤其实用——持续的计划操作与频繁发布极易导致数据更改日志大小快速增长。 

借助这些提醒，您将获得： 

  • 模型健康状况的更高透明度   
  • 在问题出现前主动缩减日志大小的控制权 
  • 避免因日志过大而导致发布受阻的频繁中断 

配置管理   

管理通知配置   

具备相关权限的管理员或用户可通过以下路径配置数据更改日志提醒：   

系统 > 管理 > 通知 > 数据更改日志通知 

在这里，您可以：   

  • 自定义阈值大小   
  • 选择通知方式（应用内、电子邮件或两者）   
  • 指定需要接收通知的人员 

提示：为避免打扰用户，建议将阈值至少设为 60%，默认值为 80%。 

电子邮件通知的用户首选项设置 

对于“数据更改日志”对象类型具有“删除”权限的用户，或被手动添加到自定义收件人列表中的用户，可通过以下路径管理个人邮件首选项： 

个人资料设置 > 用户首选项 > 数据更改日志通知 

在这里，用户可以根据需要开启或关闭电子邮件通知。 

结果 

当任意模型的数据更改日志达到设定阈值时，系统会自动触发通知。 

当您收到通知时，建议尽快缩小日志大小，以免在发布数据时受到干扰。您可以导航到“数据更改日志”来执行此操作，借助灵活的筛选条件快速定位并删除日志记录；如需留档，可先将记录导出备份。 

结论 

借助这一全新的通知功能，您可以更有效地监控数据更改日志的健康状态，保障系统持续稳定运行。

entry.title: Dynamically setting chart positions based on measure values
entry.content:
The 4 KPIs (numeric point charts) are dynamically positioned left to right based on the measure value they contain.
  Highest on the left , lowest at the far right.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Setup overview
1. Script variable: 'charts'   type: chart    array: true

2. Onitialisation Script

// populate the dropdown with members of the sales manager dimension
var mem=Chart_1.getDataSource().getMembers("Sales_Manager__5w3m5d06b5");
Dropdown_1.addItem('All');
for (var i=0;i<mem.length;i++)
	{Dropdown_1.addItem(mem[i].id,mem[i].description);}
Dropdown_1.setSelectedKey('All');

//populate the charts script variable with all charts in the story
charts=Application.getWidgets({type:WidgetType.Chart});


3. Dropdown_1 onSelect Script

var key=this.getSelectedKey();
for(var i=0;i<charts.length;i++)	{charts[i].getDataSource().removeDimensionFilter("Sales_Manager__5w3m5d06b5");
	 if(key!=='All') {	 charts[i].getDataSource().setDimensionFilter("Sales_Manager__5w3m5d06b5",key);}}

Timer_1.start(1);

4. Timer_1  onTimeout Script

// re-order charts high to low - left to right

// Step 1: Set up two typed arrays
var chartNames = ArrayUtils.create(Type.Chart);  // chart.getName()
var chartValues = ArrayUtils.create(Type.number); // converted rawValue

// Step 2: Populate both arrays
for (var ia = 0; ia < charts.length; ia++) {
    var name = charts[ia];
    var raw = charts[ia].getDataSource().getResultSet()[0][Alias.MeasureDimension].rawValue;
    var value = ConvertUtils.stringToNumber(raw);

    chartNames.push(name);
    chartValues.push(value);
}

// Step 3: Bubble sort both arrays together — high to low
for (var i = 0; i < chartValues.length - 1; i++) {
    for (var j = 0; j < chartValues.length - i - 1; j++) {
        if (chartValues[j] < chartValues[j + 1]) {
            // Swap values
            var tempVal = chartValues[j];
            chartValues[j] = chartValues[j + 1];
            chartValues[j + 1] = tempVal;

            // Swap corresponding chart names
            var tempName = chartNames[j];
            chartNames[j] = chartNames[j + 1];
            chartNames[j + 1] = tempName;
        }
    }
}

// Define starting position and spacing
var leftPos = 50;         // Starting X position
var spacingGap = 50;      // Gap between charts

// Reposition each chart based on the previous chart's width
for (var iz = 0; iz < chartNames.length; iz++) {
    var chart = chartNames[iz];

    // Set chart left position
    chart.getLayout().setLeft(leftPos);

    // Update leftPos for the next chart
    var chartWidth = chart.getLayout().getWidth().value; // Get current chart width
    leftPos = leftPos + chartWidth + spacingGap;
}

The Chart sorting is placed in a Timer as we need to ensure the data has fully refreshed before trying to retrieve the values and apply the chart sort.

entry.title: Easier Integration of SAP CIS with BDC (SAC, DSP, BDCC) with a new Identity Provider Administration
entry.content:
Overview

SAP Cloud Identity Services (CIS) are a group of services which enable you to integrate identity and access management between systems. The goal is to provide a seamless single sign-on experience across systems while ensuring that system and data access are secure.

CIS provides several out-of-the-box features that your BDC Components and Non-BDC SAC/Datasphere do not have. 

The new IDP Admin tool will be turned on sometime in Q3. We will have a phased deployment strategy on different landscapes.

 

Why should we integrate with IAS?

Integration with SAP CIS will solve many of the identity challenges facing BDC and Non-BDC tenants. Over the years, we've had a number of influence requests asking for features related to identity in SAC and Datasphere. With a deeper integration with CIS, we can tackle many of those influence requests.

Here are just some of the benefits you will receive with integration with CIS: 

  • Ability to bypass SSO
  • Moves the Groups=sac requirement onto IAS, instead of your corporate IDP
  • Supports multiple corporate Identity Providers
  • Single IAS can be used for SuccessFactors and then BDC
  • Improved Monitoring and Auditing
  • Improved Security in which you can use SAML or OpenID Connect
  • Future proofing as most enhancements to authentication will be made to IAS

To make it easier to "bundle" with CIS, we have updated our Identity Provisioning Administration Tool (IDP-Admin). 

In this blog, I'll show you how to do this step by step

Getting Started

  • Persona: Administrator - You are the System Owner of tenant (SAC, DSP or BDCC)
  • Terminology: When referring to BDC Components or BDC, we are referring to SAP Analytics Cloud, Datasphere and Databricks. Although our example is coming out of SAP Analytics Cloud.  
  • The bundling tool is also available for Non-BDC SAC and Datasphere. In general, you may see this grouped in with BDC as the workflows are the same. 

How to do it?

In the below example, I'll cover the most common scenario our customers are dealing with. Your SAC or Datasphere is currently configured with your Corporate IDP directly.  

CIS Integration with your Corporate Identity Provider

In tenants where you are already using your corporate IDP with SAC/DSP/BDCC or you intend on using your corporate IDP, follow these steps. 

 

  1. Go to System > Administration > Security and scroll down to click on Launch Identity Provider Administration Tool
  2. Logon to Identity Provider Administration Tool (IDP Admin) using the System Owner user. If you don't have an account, click Register to create a new account. 
  3. Once logged in, you will see a tile representing the BDC Component (either SAC, DSP or BDCC).

    In our example, we have an SAC system. 

     


    From the context menu, Repair IdP will allow you to revert back to the default IDP or update the IDP metadata.


    For bundling, please select Add SAP Cloud Identity Services
    ** Note down the Tenant Type as this will be important in a few steps **

  4. The next screen will show you a list of all CIS tenants that you have deployed. You are entitled to Production and Test CIS tenants. If an IAS tenant is already used by another tenant like SuccessFactors or Ariba, this will appear on the list.  In addition, if you have purchased an IAS separately, it will also appear on this list. 



    As a best practice, it is recommended you select the IAS tenant that matches your tenant type from the Tile (in Step 3) 

    If you do not have any CIS provisioned yet, the Provision New SAP Cloud Identity Services Tenant button is enabled. This will provision a IAS which you can then bundle to.

  5. Input the System Owner details

  6. The last step is a summary of actions. 



    Click Finish
  7. CIS will be provisioned with your current tenant. This step does NOT change over the authentication source quite yet.




    Success!

    Clicking Continue will bring you to the final set up stage which is to validate and turn on authentication. In our case, since we are planning on integration our corporate IDP solution, we will click Close. 

  8. Log into CIS and go to Applications & Resources > Applications. You will see a new entry representing the BDC tenant that was just bundled.

    ** Note although the application has been created and some pre-configuration has been done, the authentication has not switched over to IAS yet. **

  9. The next step is an important step because we are going to use the same corporate IdP as before. To do this, follow these steps here: https://help.sap.com/docs/cloud-identity-services/cloud-identity-services/create-corporate-idp-in-administration-console?version=Cloud 

  10. Ensure that the Application's default authenticating Identity Provider is set to the corporate identity provider
  11. Check the Corporate Identity Providers in IAS to make sure "Use Identity Authentication user store" is enabled. This will make sure that the assertions contain the data needed by SAC/DSP/BDCC
  12. Now that you have configured your corporate IdP, it's time to finish the configuration and switch over the authentication.
    Go back to IDP Admin and then go to the Tile. 

    You can see the tile still says it is pending. Simply click on the
  13. Select an attribute type (default Email), provide the subject name identifier and select dynamic user creation if desired.



    **Note: Dynamic User creation will create new users during the logon time.
    For instance, I send a story to Sarah in SAC. Sarah has never used SAC before. She clicks on the link and she is prompted for her corporate portal login. A SAC user is created for Sarah and her user will now appear in System > Users. Sarah is now able to view the story. 


  14. The next step requires you open a new tab in incognito mode and use the validation URL. Make sure any existing Incognito windows signed into SAC are closed before opening the new one. 



    Log onto the tenant and then you should see:

    Close the tab

  15. Go back to the previous window and select validate login:




  16. Review the settings and then click Finish



     

  17. The following success message should appear: 


     

  18. The tile has now been updated. 
  19. You have now completed the bundling exercise. You can now take advantage of the amazing features that IAS brings. Find all the documentation here: https://help.sap.com/docs/cloud-identity-services

 

Quick Q&A

 

Q: I have set up my corporate IDP, but I want to bypass SSO to log into SAC or Datasphere. How do I do that?

A: Use Conditional Authentication in IAS for the application. Create a rule specifically for a email domain or a group to use the Identity Authentication (local IAS user) instead of the corporate IDP.  More details here 

Q: How do I set up multiple Corporate IDP's?

A: Add a second IDP through IAS > Identity Providers > Corporate Identity Providers. After that, in the IAS application, add conditional authentication to support multiple IDP's based on email domain or groups.

Q: Does having multiple Corporate IDPs impact licensing for SAC?

A: No it should not impact licensing as the license thresholds are based on SAC Users that are created in the system. 

Q: How will a greenfield situation work where a tenant is new and has no users

A: The steps for greenfield will nearly be the same. At a high level, you would still go to IDP Admin and trigger the bundling. After the bundling step is done, you can configure the corporate IDP or just choose to leave it IAS as the main identity provider.

entry.title: Implementing SAP Emarsys Loyalty Management - Part 1
entry.content:
Introduction and Overview

This blog presents an end-to-end architecture for SAP Emarsys Loyalty, bringing together loyalty program design, omnichannel engagement, and closed-loop financial posting to strengthen repeat purchases and customer lifetime value.

It provides a structured view of how the solution is organized—covering applications, modules, and data objects and illustrates core processes such as onboarding, plan and tier-based accrual, voucher or points redemption, and service-driven adjustments.

Additionally, it explains how segmentation, personalization tokens, and analytics with Datasphere and SAC will be leveraged to operationalize loyalty programs and measure outcomes across channels.

Architecture

The following reference architecture explains how SAP Emarsys Loyalty can be implemented with other SAP solutions, though it may vary for different customer implementations depending on the systems they use.              Emarsys Loyalty Architecture

Based on this reference architecture, the following SAP solutions are proposed for integration with SAP Emarsys Loyalty.

  • SAP S/4 HANA will handle loyalty points earned through transactions such as sales orders and retail purchases, with real-time posting of point accruals and redemptions to ensure financial accuracy.
  • Web or mobile apps may be used to let customers check their loyalty activity, view offers and exclusive access, and track points, tiers, and plans through a digital wallet.
  • SAP Service Cloud will give customer service agents a complete view of the loyalty profile, including tier, balance, and past redemptions, enabling them to resolve issues like missing points, redemption problems, or upgrades.
  • Campaign channels such as email, mobile, and web will be used to run loyalty campaigns, encourage purchases, share offers, and update customers on their tier or points status.
  • Finally, SAP Datasphere and SAP Analytics Cloud will provide reports, dashboards, and stories related to loyalty performance.

 

End-to-End Loyalty process flow

Customer Registration and Loyalty on Boarding

Customer registration and loyalty onboarding start with joining the program to enjoy benefits from purchases and activities. New customers can enroll during registration, while existing customers can join anytime. For both, a hash ID must be generated and assigned to their record before they can join. Enrollment can be done through mobile apps, websites, or POS systems.

 

Points accrual

Points accrual allows customers to earn loyalty points and benefits based on their purchases and activities. For purchases, data is sent from SAP ERP to Smart Insight and then to Loyalty, where points and benefits are calculated based on the customer’s plan and tier. The confirmed points are then sent back to SAP ERP/S4 HANA for financial posting.

 

Points Redemption:

 At checkout, customers can either use an existing voucher they have already claimed or pay directly with their points. When a voucher is claimed, the points are redeemed at that time. If customers pay directly with points, the points are deducted from their balance, and the financial postings are then processed in SAP S/4HANA. 

 

Customer Service Support scenarios for points

Customer service support for points comes into play when customers raise issues such as missing rewards, incorrect deductions, or other loyalty-related queries. A ticket or case is created in the Service Cloud, where an agent can view the customer’s loyalty profile through an interface. The agent can then adjust points or tiers as needed, and each change triggers the corresponding financial postings in SAP S/4HANA

 

Loyalty Segmentation, Personalization and Campaigns

 Loyalty segmentation, personalization, and campaigns are managed using relational data templates to create customer segments. These segments are then used across different channels to run targeted campaigns. Personalization tokens ensure that campaign messages are customized for each customer before being sent.

 

Loyalty reports and Dashboards

Loyalty data is shared with Google Cloud Platform through open data views. These views can be used to build models within SAP Datasphere, and the models are then consumed in SAP Analytics Cloud for reporting and analysis.

 

Conclusion

This blog lays out an architecture blueprint for SAP Emarsys Loyalty, showing how businesses can run smarter, more connected loyalty programs by combining customer engagement, financial accuracy, and personalized experiences. It supports the complete loyalty lifecycle from enrollment, earning and burning points, to customer service and reporting, while integrating seamlessly with SAP systems such as S/4HANA, Service Cloud, and Analytics Cloud, along with mobile and web apps. This ensures customers enjoy a smooth, rewarding experience across all touchpoints, while businesses strengthen retention, boost revenue, and build lasting brand loyalty.

Stay tuned for upcoming posts where we will share business processes, customizations, and technical insights—highlighting how each component comes together to deliver a seamless loyalty experience.

To be continued…

entry.title: Dynamic MTD/QTD/YTD Calculation in SAC story using Restricted Measure
entry.content:
Introduction

Business users often need to analyze performance not just for the current month, but also on a cumulative basis for the year. Typical requirements include:

  • Month-to-Date (MTD)

  • Year-to-Date (YTD)

In SAC, these comparisons can be achieved with restricted measures and calculated measures, ensuring results update dynamically based on the month selected.

Nomenclature

We’ll use the following shorthand throughout:

  • CY → Current Year

  • PY → Previous Year

  • Cur → Current (Month/Year)

  • Prev → Previous (Month/Year)

Example: Month Selected = Nov 2014

Month-to-Date (MTD)

Measure Definition Example (Nov 2014 selected)

CY Prev MTDCurrent Year Previous MTDOct 2014
PY Cur MTDPrevious Year Current MTDNov 2013
PY Prev MTDPrevious Year Previous MTDOct 2013

Year-to-Date (YTD)

CY Cur YTDCurrent Year Current YTDJan–Nov 2014
CY Prev YTDCurrent Year Previous YTDJan–Oct 2014
PY Cur YTDPrevious Year Current YTDJan–Nov 2013
PY Prev YTDPrevious Year Previous YTDJan–Oct 2013

When implemented in SAC, the tables update automatically based on the month selection.

Conclusion

By combining restricted measures and calculated measures in SAC, you can design reports that automatically adjust to user-selected months. This eliminates manual effort and provides instant insights for business users.
